name: Militant Angel
oracle_text: Flying, lifelink
When Militant Angel enters the battlefield, create a number of 2/2 white Knight creature tokens with vigilance equal to the number of opponents you attacked this turn.

name: Inspired Sphinx
oracle_text: Flying
When Inspired Sphinx enters the battlefield, draw cards equal to the number of opponents you have.
{3}{U}: Create a 1/1 colorless Thopter artifact creature token with flying.

name: Rot Hulk
oracle_text: Menace
When Rot Hulk enters the battlefield, return up to X target Zombie cards from your graveyard to the battlefield, where X is the number of opponents you have.

name: Goblin Goliath
oracle_text: When Goblin Goliath enters the battlefield, create a number of 1/1 red Goblin creature tokens equal to the number of opponents you have.
{3}{R}, {T}: If a source you control would deal damage to an opponent this turn, it deals double that damage to that player instead.

name: Avatar of Growth
oracle_text: This spell costs {1} less to cast for each opponent you have.
Trample
When Avatar of Growth enters the battlefield, each player searches their library for up to two basic land cards, puts them onto the battlefield, then shuffles their library.

name: Aerial Responder
oracle_text: Flying, vigilance, lifelink

name: Always Watching
oracle_text: Nontoken creatures you control get +1/+1 and have vigilance.
flavor_text:
"We pray to Avacyn on high.
On snow-white wings fearless you fly.
Keep safe our souls. Keep safe our lives.
May angels watch us from the skies."
—Children's prayer

name: Benalish Marshal
oracle_text: Other creatures you control get +1/+1.
flavor_text:
"Some aspire to climb the mountain of Honor. The Benalish are born upon its peak, and from there ascend among the stars."
—History of Benalia

rulings.text: Because damage remains marked on a creature until it’s removed as the turn ends, nonlethal damage dealt to a creature you control may become lethal if Benalish Marshal leaves the battlefield during that turn.

name: Bright Reprisal
oracle_text: Destroy target attacking creature.
Draw a card.
flavor_text: Vampires know blood and the systems that carry it. And they know exactly where to strike to set it free.

rulings.text: If the target creature is an illegal target by the time Bright Reprisal resolves, the entire spell doesn’t resolve. You won’t draw a card. If, on the other hand, the target is a legal target but isn’t destroyed (most likely because it has indestructible), you’ll draw a card.

name: Call the Cavalry
oracle_text: Create two 2/2 white Knight creature tokens with vigilance.
flavor_text: Benalish citizens born under the same constellations share a star-clan. Their loyalty to one another interlaces the Seven Houses.

name: Everdawn Champion
oracle_text: Prevent all combat damage that would be dealt to Everdawn Champion.
flavor_text:
"Undefeated in battle, she is the shining future our empire deserves."
—Huatli

rulings.text: Combat damage can be assigned to Everdawn Champion as normal, even though that damage will be prevented. For example, if Everdawn Champion blocks a 4/4 creature with trample, the attacking player may assign 2 of that creature’s combat damage to the player or planeswalker it’s attacking.

name: Fan Bearer
oracle_text: {2}, {T}: Tap target creature.
flavor_text: Rest sometimes requires the right prompting.

name: Inspired Charge
oracle_text: Creatures you control get +2/+1 until end of turn.
flavor_text:
"For the lands you have lost and the beauty that remains, for freedom and the future, we must hold nothing back!"
—Gideon Jura

rulings.text: The set of creatures affected by Inspired Charge is determined as the spell resolves. Creatures you begin to control later in the turn and noncreature permanents that become creatures later in the turn won’t get +2/+1.

name: Inspiring Captain
oracle_text: When Inspiring Captain enters the battlefield, creatures you control get +1/+1 until end of turn.
flavor_text: "Our enemies will soon discover that we are not as meek as they had believed."

rulings.text: The set of creatures affected by Inspiring Captain’s ability is determined as the ability resolves. Creatures you begin to control later in the turn won’t get +1/+1.

name: Mesa Unicorn
oracle_text: Lifelink
flavor_text: The unicorns of Sursi are a manifestation of Serra's joy and compassion. They frolic and dance like children, offering blessings to anyone they encounter.

name: Serra Angel
oracle_text: Flying, vigilance
flavor_text: The angel remembers her past lives like dreams. Her song held up meadows. Her blade drove back darkness. Her wings carried her across the ages.

name: Subjugator Angel
oracle_text: Flying
When Subjugator Angel enters the battlefield, tap all creatures your opponents control.
flavor_text: The remnants of Innistrad's corrupted angelic hosts collapsed to form the Flight of Nightmares.

name: Advanced Stitchwing
oracle_text: Flying
{2}{U}, Discard two cards: Return Advanced Stitchwing from your graveyard to the battlefield tapped.
flavor_text:
"Improvement is a consequence of practice."
—Stitcher Geralf

rulings.text: Advanced Stitchwing’s last ability can only be activated while it’s in your graveyard.

name: Air Elemental
oracle_text: Flying (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with flying or reach.)
flavor_text: Pray that it doesn't seek the safety of your lungs.

name: Claustrophobia
oracle_text: Enchant creature
When Claustrophobia enters the battlefield, tap enchanted creature.
Enchanted creature doesn't untap during its controller's untap step.
flavor_text: Six feet of earth muffled his cries.

rulings.text: Claustrophobia can target and enchant a tapped or untapped creature.
The enchanted creature can still be untapped in other ways. Claustrophobia will remain attached, and the creature will continue to not untap during its controller’s untap step.

name: Favorable Winds
oracle_text: Creatures you control with flying get +1/+1.
flavor_text:
"Like ribbons of wind and wisdom the coatls fly, twisting mystery into truth, shaping the clouds to suit their inscrutable will."
—Huatli

name: Hydrolash
oracle_text: Attacking creatures get -2/-0 until end of turn.
Draw a card.
flavor_text:
"I don't need your mage-rings or your mana equations. I call, and the sea answers."
—Keyta, rebel hydromancer

rulings.text: You may cast Hydrolash even if there aren’t any attacking creatures simply to draw a card.

name: Reckless Scholar
oracle_text: {T}: Target player draws a card, then discards a card.
flavor_text: Progress comes at a price.

name: Soulblade Djinn
oracle_text: Flying
Whenever you cast a noncreature spell, creatures you control get +1/+1 until end of turn.
flavor_text: He grants endless wishes, as long as you always wish for a blade.

rulings.text: Any spell you cast that doesn’t have the type creature will cause Soulblade Djinn’s ability to trigger. If a spell has multiple types, and one of those types is creature (such as an artifact creature), casting it won’t cause the ability to trigger. Playing a land also won’t cause it to trigger.
Soulblade Djinn’s ability goes on the stack on top of the spell that caused it to trigger. It will resolve before that spell.

name: Whirler Rogue
oracle_text: When Whirler Rogue enters the battlefield, create two 1/1 colorless Thopter artifact creature tokens with flying.
Tap two untapped artifacts you control: Target creature can't be blocked this turn.

rulings.text: You may tap any two untapped artifacts you control, including artifact creatures that haven’t been under your control continuously since the beginning of your most recent turn.
Activating the second ability of Whirler Rogue after a creature has become blocked won’t cause it to become unblocked.

name: Zahid, Djinn of the Lamp
oracle_text: You may pay {3}{U} and tap an untapped artifact you control rather than pay this spell's mana cost.
Flying
flavor_text: "I do as I please, little mortal. Do go on about your wishes, though—they amuse me to no end."

name: Bone Splinters
oracle_text: As an additional cost to cast this spell, sacrifice a creature.
Destroy target creature.
flavor_text: Vastly outnumbered, the Zendikari found creative ways to even the odds.

rulings.text: You must sacrifice exactly one creature to cast this spell; you can’t cast it without sacrificing a creature, and you can’t sacrifice additional creatures.
Once you begin to cast Bone Splinters, no player may take actions until you’re done. Notably, opponents can’t try to remove the creature you wish to sacrifice.

You can cast Bone Splinters targeting the creature you intend to sacrifice for its cost. This is because targets are chosen before costs are paid. Bone Splinters won’t resolve as it tries to resolve in this case.

name: Cruel Revival
oracle_text: Destroy target non-Zombie creature. It can't be regenerated. Return up to one target Zombie card from your graveyard to your hand.
flavor_text: On Innistrad, Liliana embraced necromancy, honing her powers by practicing on scores of undead—and sometimes the living.

name: Fleshbag Marauder
oracle_text: When Fleshbag Marauder enters the battlefield, each player sacrifices a creature.
flavor_text: Grixis is a world where the only things found in abundance are death and decay. Corpses, whole or in part, are the standard currency among necromancers and demons.

rulings.text: When the ability resolves, you may sacrifice Fleshbag Marauder itself. If you control no other creatures, you’ll have to sacrifice Fleshbag Marauder.

As Fleshbag Marauder’s ability resolves, first you choose a creature to sacrifice, then each other player in turn order chooses a creature to sacrifice, then all those creatures are sacrificed simultaneously.

name: Gruesome Fate
oracle_text: Each opponent loses 1 life for each creature you control.
flavor_text:
"You were keen enough to sink your fangs into us, vampire! And now you're afraid of a few little nibbles?"
—Udvil "Ratty" Ratlock

rulings.text: In a Two-Headed Giant game, Gruesome Fate causes the opposing team to lose 2 life for each creature you control.

name: Languish
oracle_text: All creatures get -4/-4 until end of turn.
flavor_text: Life is such a fragile thing.

name: Liliana's Mastery
oracle_text: Zombies you control get +1/+1.
When Liliana's Mastery enters the battlefield, create two 2/2 black Zombie creature tokens.
flavor_text: "There are so many of them. It seems they've just been waiting for someone to serve."

name: Lord of the Accursed
oracle_text: Other Zombies you control get +1/+1.
{1}{B}, {T}: All Zombies gain menace until end of turn.
flavor_text: The Curse of Wandering leaves only hatred.

name: Tattered Mummy
oracle_text: When Tattered Mummy dies, each opponent loses 2 life.
flavor_text: The dead who wander beyond the safety of the city crave only to spread their curse.

rulings.text: If your life total is brought to 0 or less at the same time that Tattered Mummy is dealt lethal damage, you lose the game before its triggered ability goes on the stack.
In a Two-Headed Giant game, the triggered ability of Tattered Mummy causes the opposing team to lose 4 life.

name: Thallid Soothsayer
oracle_text: {2}, Sacrifice a creature: Draw a card.
flavor_text: Some of the thallids that escaped into the fens of Urborg began emulating the Cabal's bloodsoaked rituals in their own peculiar way.

rulings.text: You can sacrifice Thallid Soothsayer to pay the cost for its own ability.

name: Zulaport Cutthroat
oracle_text: Whenever Zulaport Cutthroat or another creature you control dies, each opponent loses 1 life and you gain 1 life.
flavor_text: "Eldrazi? Ha! Try walking through Zulaport at night with your pockets full. Now that's dangerous."

rulings.text: If Zulaport Cutthroat dies at the same time as another creature you control, its ability triggers for that creature.
In a Two-Headed Giant game, Zulaport Cutthroat’s ability causes the opposing team to lose 2 life and you to gain 1 life.

name: Bombard
oracle_text: Bombard deals 4 damage to target creature.
flavor_text:
"Want to sink a ship? Blow a hole in the hull. Want to kill a regisaur? Same answer."
—Captain Brandis Thorn

name: Captivating Crew
oracle_text: {3}{R}: Gain control of target creature an opponent controls until end of turn. Untap that creature. It gains haste until end of turn. Activate this ability only any time you could cast a sorcery.
flavor_text: "We sail. We plunder. Then we dance."

rulings.text: You can target and gain control of an untapped creature this way.

name: Dragon Fodder
oracle_text: Create two 1/1 red Goblin creature tokens.
flavor_text: Goblins journey to the sacrificial peaks in pairs so that the rare survivor might be able to relate the details of the other's grisly demise.

name: Rolling Thunder
oracle_text: Rolling Thunder deals X damage divided as you choose among any number of targets.
flavor_text:
"Zendikar is always angry, though I've never seen that anger so precisely directed."
—Nablus, North Hada trapper

rulings.text: If X is greater than 0, you can’t choose zero targets. You must choose between one and X targets. If X is 0, you can’t choose any targets.
You choose how many targets Rolling Thunder has and how the damage is divided as you cast the spell. Each target must receive at least 1 damage.

If some, but not all, of the targets become illegal by the time Rolling Thunder tries to resolve, the original division of damage still applies, but no damage is dealt to illegal targets. If all the targets are illegal, the spell won’t resolve.
If Rolling Thunder is copied, the copy will retain the original damage divsion. The spell or ability will likely allow you to choose new targets, but you can’t change the way damage is divided.

name: Seismic Elemental
oracle_text: When Seismic Elemental enters the battlefield, creatures without flying can't block this turn.
flavor_text:
"Trying to stop it would be foolish. If you feel it coming—run!"
—Sergeant Ryda

rulings.text: No creature without flying will be able to block that turn, including creatures that lose flying after Seismic Elemental’s ability resolves and creatures without flying that enter the battlefield after that ability resolves.

name: Siege-Gang Commander
oracle_text: When Siege-Gang Commander enters the battlefield, create three 1/1 red Goblin creature tokens.
{1}{R}, Sacrifice a Goblin: Siege-Gang Commander deals 2 damage to any target.
flavor_text: "Ready . . . uh . . . fire!"

rulings.text: You can sacrifice any Goblin you control to activate Siege-Gang Commander’s activated ability, not just the ones its triggered ability puts onto the battlefield. You can even sacrifice Siege-Gang Commander itself.

name: Tormenting Voice
oracle_text: As an additional cost to cast this spell, discard a card.
Draw two cards.
flavor_text: "You are undeserving of the afterlife. You will never feel the God-Pharaoh's embrace."

rulings.text: You must discard exactly one card to cast Tormenting Voice; you can’t cast it without discarding a card, and you can’t discard additional cards.

name: Ghalta, Primal Hunger
oracle_text: This spell costs {X} less to cast, where X is the total power of creatures you control.
Trample
flavor_text: The earth walks, strongest of all.

rulings.text: To determine Ghalta’s total cost, start with the mana cost (or an alternative cost if another card’s effect allows you to pay one instead), add any cost increases, then apply any cost reductions. Ghalta’s converted mana cost remains unchanged, no matter what the total cost to cast it was.

The total cost to cast Ghalta is locked in before you pay that cost. For example, if you control three 2/2 creatures, including one you can sacrifice to add {C} to your mana pool, the total cost of Ghalta is {4}{G}{G}. Then you can sacrifice the creature when you activate mana abilities just before paying the cost.
If a creature’s power is somehow less than 0, it subtracts from the total power of your other creatures. If the total power of your creatures is 0 or less, Ghalta’s cost remains {10}{G}{G}.
Ghalta’s first ability can’t reduce its cost below {G}{G}.

name: Jungle Delver
oracle_text: {3}{G}: Put a +1/+1 counter on Jungle Delver.
flavor_text: "There is no power too great to be used in the defense of our ancestral lands."

name: Llanowar Elves
oracle_text: {T}: Add {G}.
flavor_text: As patient and generous as life, as harsh and merciless as nature.

name: Nissa's Revelation
oracle_text: Scry 5, then reveal the top card of your library. If it's a creature card, you draw cards equal to its power and you gain life equal to its toughness.
flavor_text: The evil inside the mountain pulsed at Nissa in a shock wave of madness.

rulings.text: If the top card of your library isn’t a creature card or it’s a creature card with power 0 or less, you won’t draw any cards. Otherwise, the first card you draw will be the card you revealed.

name: Overcome
oracle_text: Creatures you control get +2/+2 and gain trample until end of turn.
flavor_text:
"Forward! Until the horizon is ours!"
—Khemses, charioteer

name: Seek the Wilds
oracle_text: Look at the top four cards of your library. You may reveal a creature or land card from among them and put it into your hand. Put the rest on the bottom of your library in any order.
flavor_text: "In my downtime I used to paint the vistas. Now the vistas disappear faster than my downtime."

name: Thrashing Brontodon
oracle_text: {1}, Sacrifice Thrashing Brontodon: Destroy target artifact or enchantment.
flavor_text: It cares more about preserving the herd's territory than about preserving itself.

name: Eager Construct
oracle_text: When Eager Construct enters the battlefield, each player may scry 1. (To scry 1, look at the top card of your library, then you may put that card on the bottom of your library.)
flavor_text: Loyal to a fault, it anticipates its master's every need.

rulings.text: As Eager Construct’s triggered ability resolves, first the player whose turn it is scrys 1, then each other player in turn order does the same. Each player will know the choices made by players who chose before them.

If multiple players are instructed to scry at once, such as while resolving Eager Construct’s triggered ability, those players each look at the top card of their library at the same time, then they choose in turn order whether to put those cards on the top or bottom of their library.

name: Filigree Familiar
oracle_text: When Filigree Familiar enters the battlefield, you gain 2 life.
When Filigree Familiar dies, draw a card.
flavor_text:
"It's the must-have gift for everyone on your list. Get one for yourself, too!"
—Chammi, curio vendor

name: Howling Golem
oracle_text: Whenever Howling Golem attacks or blocks, each player draws a card.
flavor_text: It wails of buried riches and the souls lost seeking them.

rulings.text: After Howling Golem’s triggered ability resolves, players can cast spells and activate abilities before blockers are declared if it’s attacking, or before damage is dealt if it’s blocking.

name: Manalith
oracle_text: {T}: Add one mana of any color.
flavor_text:
"Though the afterlife, the city, and even the God-Pharaoh himself were one great deception, the ideals championed by the gods remain true."
—Djeru, former Tah-crop initiate

name: Pilgrim's Eye
oracle_text: Flying
When Pilgrim's Eye enters the battlefield, you may search your library for a basic land card, reveal it, put it into your hand, then shuffle your library.
flavor_text: Each time it is sent to find a safe haven, it takes longer to return.

name: Rhonas's Monument
oracle_text: Green creature spells you cast cost {1} less to cast.
Whenever you cast a creature spell, target creature you control gets +2/+2 and gains trample until end of turn.

rulings.text: The triggered ability of Rhonas’s Monument can’t target the creature spell that caused it to trigger.

Each Monument has one ability that reduces the cost of creature spells of a certain color, and a triggered ability that triggers whenever you cast any creature spell—not just a creature spell of that color.

A creature spell that’s multiple colors is each of those colors. For example, Ahn-Crop Champion is a white creature and a green creature, so it can benefit from either Oketra’s Monument or Rhonas’s Monument—or both at once.

To determine the total cost of a creature spell, start with the mana cost or alternative cost you’re paying, add any cost increases, then apply any cost reductions. The converted mana cost of the creature remains unchanged, no matter what the total cost to cast it was.
Each Monument’s triggered ability triggers as the creature spell is cast and resolves before that creature spell resolves. The ability will resolve even if that creature spell is countered.

name: Snare Thopter
oracle_text: Flying, haste
flavor_text:
"I did not think I would understand the cold filigree creatures of this world, but they too are governed by the laws of nature."
—Nissa Revane

name: Welder Automaton
oracle_text: {3}{R}: Welder Automaton deals 1 damage to each opponent.
flavor_text: Most of the constructs the renegades used against the Consulate weren't originally intended for combat. But some didn't require much modification.

rulings.text: In a Two-Headed Giant game, Welder Automaton’s ability causes 2 damage total to be dealt to the opposing team.
